Name: Coptic textile
Description: A fragment of textile made from a heavy natural wool ground with a broad band of madder red. Pomegranate and interlacing guilloche borders frame a repeat band of three hexagonal and one elongated guilloche motifs. These enclose human, animal and conventional motifs, with red and green additions.The technique is tapestry on woven ground, using a curved weft, built up shapes, slits and interlaced motifs woven over the surface.Ends per inch (warp thread): 24 Picks per inch (weft thread): approximately 96.
